proj_keywords-1-proj_define-Input: Crop production: field yield extracted from NDVI index and multiply by the average crop yield of corn per hectare.
sources-1-source_description-Input:
Source: gouvernement du Québec, Ministère des Forêts, de la Faune et des Parcs (MFFP),Le système d'information écoforestière (SIEF) 3e inventaire, 
purpose: Map illustrating the forest species present in the different region of quebec from 1991-2003
format: shapefile
relevance to the research project: use to identify abandoned field in the montérégie region.
proj_title-Input: Using old fields for new purposes: modelling the impact of field restoration in the Montérégie
proj_abstract-Input: Efforts to secure food sources through agriculture's expansion and industrialization have diminished landscape diversity, increasing vulnerability. While COP15 goals stress global natural space restoration, agricultural restoration creates a trade-off by reducing areas for crop production. However, utilizing unproductive lands like abandoned or degraded fields offers a potential solution. Using the agriculturally intensive Montérégie region as my model system, I will explore scenarios restoring 0-100% of all unproductive land and forecast the impact on seven ecosystem services (crop production, maple syrup, deer hunting, water regulation, carbon storage, recreation, pollination).I expect most of the impact to come from the amount of land restored and will focus on the importance of carefully planning restoration actions to maximize benefits for both people and nature.
proj_keywords-2-proj_service-Input: non-timber forest products and other biomass (e.g. maple syrup tapping, caribou hunting)
proj_keywords-2-proj_define-Input: non-timber forest product is maple syrup production and use the potential of maple syrup being produce per hectare per years
proj_keywords-3-proj_define-Input: carbon storage only look at aboveground carbon storage (t/ha)
proj_keywords-4-proj_define-Input: water purification looking at phosphorus retention and export in kg/(ha · year)
proj_keywords-6-proj_define-Input: recreation by people we use flicker number of picture taken in the Montérégie
proj_keywords-7-proj_define-Input: hunting of deer we use the number of deer kill in the region from the government dataset and use that to predict the potential for deer hunting in the region
sources-2-source_title-Input: Rieb and Bennett, 2020 paper: Landscape structure as a mediator of ecosystem service interactions
sources-2-source_description-Input:
Briefly describe the dataset source: Data and map produce by the Rieb and Bennett, 2020 paper: Landscape structure as a mediator of ecosystem service interactions paper
purpose: map where made to show the provision of six ecosystem services (crop production, water quality,  carbon storage, recreation, maple syrup production and deer hunting) and in the Monteregie in 2014. 
format: raster tiff. files
relevance to the research project: The dataset use to create these raster map as well as the raster map where use to create our model to predict each of these six ecosystem services. Furthermore, the land use land cover map produce in this study was also use has our lulc map in this project.
sources-3-source_title-Input: (BDPPAD) Base de données des parcelles et productions agricoles déclarées 2010-2014
sources-3-source_description-Input:
Briefly describe the dataset source: The Database of Declared Agricultural Plots and Productions (BDPPAD) consists of vector-format polygons representing the boundaries of agricultural plots that have been associated with the client records of La Financière agricole du Québec (FADQ) since 2003. The plots are maintained from year to year to build a parcel bank covering as much territory as possible, regardless of whether the associated client is active or not. For each insurance year, an agricultural production is linked to the plots that active clients declare cultivating.
purpose: The goal of this dataset is to have the most up to date information on the location, scale and productivity of the crop field in quebec.
format: this represent a vector shapfiles for each recorded years
relevance to the research project: This shapefiles was use has the overall description of all field present in the Monteregie. It was use to generate all the scenarios since the shapefiles superficie is provided for each individual polygone in the shapefile. It also was use to identify field that had no production for the period of 5 years 2010-2014
sources-4-source_title-Input: Cartographie de l’occupation du sol des Basses-terres du Saint-Laurent 2018
sources-4-source_description-Input:
Briefly describe the dataset source: the ECCC & MDDELCC (2018) land use land cover map which includes seven classes: water, cut and regeneration, agriculture, developed, forest, wetlands, bare soil which are further divided into 25 subclasses
purpose: To have a visual land use land cover classification of the different landscape in quebec
format: FGDB
relevance to the research project: The subclass old field was use in this project to identify field that are consider abandoned in the monteregie.
sources-5-source_description-Input:
Briefly describe the dataset source: The Landsat 5, 7, and 8 satellite images where gather for the study region using Google Earth Engine (GEE)
purpose: To be able to measure the NDVI from the study region from 2000-2021.
format: tiff.
relevance to the research project: Use to identify the field in the region which show a significant decrease in productivity over a 21 years period.
test-field_tester-Input: Shouldn't match anything, but should be added to Shiny Input RV anyways
test-field_tester-notInput: Shouldn't match anything, but should NOT be added to Shiny Input RV anyways
